# The Best Bluetooth Speakers

Our favorite portable speakers of all shapes and sizes, from clip-ons to a
massive boombox.

Portable Bluetooth speakers still rock, but thanks in large part to [the smart
speaker revolution](https://www.wired.com/story/amazon-alexa-search-for-the-
one-perfect-answer/), they aren't the hottest products around.

It's fun and easy to ask an [Amazon Echo](https://www.wired.com/gallery/best-
alexa-and-amazon-echo-speakers/) or [Google
Home](https://www.wired.com/gallery/best-google-speakers-buying-guide/) to
play your favorite track or tell you the weather, but smart speakers have a
few crutches, first and foremost being stable Wi-Fi. They also often aren't
portable or waterproofed for the great outdoors. In (mostly) forgoing smarts,
Bluetooth speakers are nearly always more versatile, more rugged, and more
portable—and they'll work with anybody's smartphone. They also sound as good
or better than many of their smart-speaker equivalents.

In the past year, we've tested more than 35 different Bluetooth speakers and
researched dozens more online, and we can happily say they are still some of
the best small devices you can listen to. Here are our favorites right now.

Be sure to check out all our [buying guides](https://www.wired.com/tag/buying-
guides/), including the [Best Soundbars](https://www.wired.com/gallery/best-
soundbars/) and [Best Smart Speakers](https://www.wired.com/story/best-smart-
speakers/) guides.

 _Updated for February 2020: We've updated links and pricing, gave a bigger
honorable mention to the Oontz Angle 3, and have removed the Riva Concert._

## Best Overall

UE Boom 3

There are bigger and badder Bluetooth speakers, but none match the fun and
convenience of the Ultimate Ears Boom 3 ([9/10, WIRED
Recommends](https://www.wired.com/review/ultimate-ears-boom-3-megaboom-3/)).
It puts out some of the most pleasant, balanced sound for its size. The
waterproof cylinder comes in multiple colors, it can last 15 hours between
charges, and it gives you 100 feet of Bluetooth range. On top of all that, it
has a two-year warranty. If you really need to get a party kicking, the
[Megaboom 3 is a beefier model](https://www.amazon.com/Ultimate-Ears-MEGABOOM-
Bluetooth-Waterproof/dp/B07DD3W154/) that amps up the bass.

[$140 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxiCzBr3qCy57SPX2rCSRUVqEzqfCwTXn9EMiYWshntHQdMARkbxHeFk3kVm575owLb?cid=5b103e5652d92f2e003123ef)

[$150 at Best
Buy](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxiCzBr3qCy57SPX2rCSRUVqEzqfCwTXn9EMjy2TPpEpZTLCAgr1LQRMh7MV6eU66uJ?cid=5b103e5652d92f2e003123ef)

[$150 at
Walmart](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxiCzBr3qCy57SPX2rCSRUVqEzqfCwTXn9EMjy2TPpEpZTLCAgr1LQRMh7MV6eU66uK?cid=5b103e5652d92f2e003123ef)

  * ![tribit maxsound plus speaker in black](https://media.wired.com/photos/5d97780e647bad0008249386/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/Gear-Tribit-MaxSound-Plus-SORUCE-Tribit.jpg)

Photograph: Tribit

## Best Bargain

Tribit MaxSound Plus

Tribit may be a brand you haven't heard of, but its line of Bluetooth speakers
sound a lot better than they should for the price. The [MaxSound Plus
($56)](https://www.amazon.com/Tribit-MaxSound-Bluetooth-Exceptional-
Waterproof/dp/B07MQWG3PR/) is my favorite model. It has dual forward-firing
drivers and passive radiators in an 8-inch-long pill shape. No, it can't fuel
a trance dance party on its own, but its sound clarity really impressed me,
and it has a fun extra bass button that adds some surprising thump. The extra
bass is a little muddy, and sure, it looks a lot like a [Beats
Pill+](https://www.amazon.com/Beats-Pill-Portable-Speaker-
Black/dp/B016QXV2QK/), but it's still fun.

With 15–20 hours of battery and an IPX7 waterproof rating (not dust-proof, but
I immersed it in water and it's fine), it's a great companion for some
backyard tunes, a trip down the river, or a ton of other informal gatherings.
If you don't need the extra bass and want an even tinier 7-inch speaker, the
[XSound Go ($33)](https://www.amazon.com/Tribit-XSound-Bluetooth-Speakers-
Built/dp/B07594HZ6Y/) is similar and also puts out clean audio for its size.

[$56 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxnUGQGAQE2uDU3SeMgb5UfVQZNnd6Wn4gNg9SWDUjEQWxt5qWYbFZqN9n9riScn8DQ?cid=5b103e5652d92f2e003123ef)

  * ![Sonos move speaker ](https://media.wired.com/photos/5d81694416adef000889c9eb/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/Gear-Sonos_Move_Green-FA.jpg)

Photograph: Sonos

## Best for Home

Sonos Move

If you want a Bluetooth speaker that can fill any room (or patio) but lives a
lot of its life inside, the Sonos Move ([8/10, WIRED
Recommends](https://www.wired.com/review/sonos-move/)) is a good speaker to
build a home network around. [Sonos invented wireless multiroom
speakers](https://www.wired.com/story/sonos-nick-millington-exclusive-
interview/). Its speakers connect to nearly every streaming service, and they
work with Google Assistant or Alexa. They also sound amazing by every measure.
Just know that the Move is primarily a wireless speaker that streams over your
Wi-Fi network, but it also functions as a Bluetooth speaker when you take it
outside, or anywhere away from Wi-Fi.

It comes with a wireless charging cradle for when it's in the kitchen, and
it's splash-resistant—I shot a hose at it, so it can get wet—for when it's by
the pool.

[$399 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxnTn1RVrRvYESaVByPhLY51v2eTDAxmmjbP3H6iTiVpsUqytnJL4t6YUu4JUjbwkYL?cid=5b103e5652d92f2e003123ef)

  * 

  * ![wonderboom speaker in blue and teal](https://media.wired.com/photos/5d97778228aa88000843485d/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/Gear-UE-Wonderboom-2-SOURCE-Ultimate-Ears.jpg)

Photograph: Ultimate Ears

## Best for Pool Parties

UE Wonderboom 2

The Ultimate Ears Wonderboom was a [WIRED Gear of the Year award
winner](https://www.wired.com/story/gear-of-the-year-2017/), and that's
because it's the best pool companion you can have, and the new Wonderboom 2 is
just a little better. The 4-inch(-ish) little ball of joy now sports IP67
water and dust resistance. It gets 13 hours of battery (three more than
before), has a 100-foot Bluetooth range, floats, and pumps out surprisingly
potent audio while doing it. UE says it's "drop-proof" up to 5 feet, but you
can honestly play some light catch with it on the lawn and it won't be any
worse for wear. Just wash it off when you're done! You can even pair two
together for proper stereo sound.

[$96 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxnUGKF7bR2EQa1iwnZaQEkpubB2AKe1pZCUgUhAi691dv5AjuPKtwYBDoYrNKi7Paf?cid=5b103e5652d92f2e003123ef)

  * ![marshall stockwell speaker with strap](https://media.wired.com/photos/5d977850a351410008cb5a75/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/Gear-Marshall-Stockwell-2-SOURCE-Marshall.jpg)

Photograph: Marshall

## Best for Rocking Out

Marshall Stockwell II

If you're a music fan, or just love the classic Marshall guitar amplifier
design, this Bluetooth speaker is ready to rock. Like all Marshall products,
you pay a price for the style, but it does live up to expectations. For a
speaker that's about as big as four DVD cases stacked, standing upright, it
sounds killer with a smooth, balanced, and refined sound.

The exterior has a durable-feeling, splash-resistant silicone finish, and the
front and back are covered with a steel grille. It has a front-facing woofer
and a tweeter on each side, powered by a battery that lasts around 20 hours
(USB-C charging with a 3.5-mm jack too), depending on how much you tweak the
stylish volume, treble, and bass knobs up top. The battery indicator is also
handy. I've enjoyed toting all 3 pounds of it around with its carry strap,
which has a leather feel on the outside and a red velvet look and feel on the
inside.

If you want a little more power and heft, the [Marshall Kilburn II
($220)](https://www.amazon.com/Marshall-Kilburn-Portable-Bluetooth-
Speaker/dp/B07H7CZ6BZ/) is similarly excellent.

[$188 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxnUGQGSLdqq5AxhAJmFRYKCvuTeua31VJaTNSYdepnjjW2ZAwyaowGXfatDwijBdSm?cid=5b103e5652d92f2e003123ef)

  * ![JBL Link 20 speaker](https://media.wired.com/photos/5b117e5d44c29b1bf25f2378/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/JBL-Link-20-SOURCE-JBL.jpg)

Photograph: JBL

## The Google Whisperer

JBL Link 20

The JBL Link 20 ([8/10, WIRED Recommends](https://www.wired.com/review/review-
jbl-link-speakers-with-google-assistant/)) is the [best portable smart
speaker](https://www.wired.com/story/best-smart-speakers/) you're gonna find,
and probably the most feature-rich speaker on this entire list outside the
Sonos Move.

It can connect via Bluetooth, but it also has Wi-Fi with Google Assistant
built-in, so you can yell "Hey Google" and get some answers. It's easy to use
and has helpful indicators so you know if it has a solid connection and when
it's running out of juice. Did I mention it's waterproof, floats, and gets 10
hours per charge? Not too shabby.

[$150 at B&H
Audio](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxi9boqU6Ze6wyezjQYuALTbUb6uQ8b1eiE2UHARzB16ReNymNirbZheDEA76rVLdjx?cid=5b103e5652d92f2e003123ef)

  * ![This image may contain Cylinder and Bottle](https://media.wired.com/photos/5a1c8a14da3ec353252a7c89/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/megablast-TA.jpg)

Photograph: Ultimate Ears

## Alexa Inside

UE Megablast

We like Google Assistant more than Amazon's Alexa, but if you're looking for a
great-sounding Bluetooth speaker with full Alexa integration, reach for this
tallboy. The UE Megablast ([8/10, WIRED
Recommends](https://www.wired.com/review/review-ultimate-ears-blast-
megablast/)) is about the size of a 24-oz can o' your favorite beverage. Think
of it like a larger, better sounding, and smarter Boom 2.

The Megablast also made our list of [Best Alexa
Speakers](https://www.wired.com/story/best-amazon-echo/). Despite its extra-
large size, it's also waterproof—so bring this to your next pool party and let
Alexa spin up some tunes.

[$199 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxi9boqVfm2G9M8VgQdLxvydQYs76PNq4uFVPs9Cmxv2jwMVsvC2AF7Ut7GH3kizfAh?cid=5b103e5652d92f2e003123ef)

  * ![JBL speaker](https://media.wired.com/photos/5b117e96afecd2652c3258ef/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/JBL-Clip-2-SOURCE-JBL.jpg)

Photograph: JBL

## Adventure Time

JBL Clip 2

The JBL Clip 2 is the size of a hockey puck—small enough that you can take it
with you on almost any adventure. It's waterproof and has a little carabiner
up top so you can snap it to all kinds of stuff. It also has more controls on
it (volume, play, Bluetooth, power) than other micro-sized speakers. The
kicker is a built-in, retractable 3.5-mm audio cable, giving you an easy way
to plug in for some quick tunes without fussing with Bluetooth.

Don't need the 3.5-mm cable? The newer [JBL Clip 3 sounds slightly
better](https://www.amazon.com/JBL-Portable-Waterproof-Wireless-
Bluetooth/dp/B07CVRZYF3/), but it doesn't have the 3.5-mm cable built in, and
its carabiner doesn't bend up and down.

[$49 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxi9boqWdsrS8itFuuCMnsyd8dTRq2SCXsGD6HTvJyvuG7xXFoUrKfuAbrXHZFmSUuv?cid=5b103e5652d92f2e003123ef)

  * ![Bose speaker](https://media.wired.com/photos/5b117ee7bc638c7149b94bd5/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/Bose-SoundLink-Micro-SOURCE-Bose.jpg)

Photograph: Bose

## Bike Lock

Bose Soundlink Micro

The Bose SoundLink Micro is about the same size as the Clip 2 and has a
stretchy silicone strap on the back that's taut enough that it'll stick to
bike handlebars or a backpack strap when you're on the move. Thanks to an
extra passive radiator next to the main driver, it sounds way better than
other tiny speakers and even pumps out some legitimate bass—all while
maintaining a rugged, waterproof design and 6 hours of battery life.

[$79 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxi9boqWhVyawQiHhPhsQmuUgUYNoeYqA69gJjWw55eBGX4Aq6jAaht4UMn7CzRGUFu?cid=5b103e5652d92f2e003123ef)

  * ![Anker speaker](https://media.wired.com/photos/5b117bfd5db69615da05cdab/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/Anker-Soundcore-Flare-SOURCE-Anker.jpg)

Photograph: Anker

## Light Bright

Anker Soundcore Flare

Anker is known for affordable accessories that actually work, and the
Soundcore Flare is the perfect example. It's a very capable soda-can-sized
waterproof Bluetooth speaker with a beat-driven LED light ring and 12 hours of
battery life. It even has dual drivers and passive radiators for 360-degree
sound, and an app with some equalizer settings. It doesn't sound quite as good
as more expensive speakers, but it's certainly good enough for most
situations. At $60, that's damn impressive. Plus, it lights up!

[$62 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxi9bopKiRyEjajJAjdpGpFDJRFvxtwSqtZAcd1urZVkKW3dyLJwyjG2iA2oZJnnSQ7?cid=5b103e5652d92f2e003123ef)

  * ![LG Speaker](https://media.wired.com/photos/5c09826c69c8102d11a917bd/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/LG-Xboom-Go-PK5-SOURCE-LG.jpg)

Photograph: LG

## Porta Party

LG Xboom Go PK5

The LG PK5 is a great speaker for outdoor or backyard events. It looks odd,
but the beat-driven party lights are a blast if you're in the mood. It's also
splash-proof and puts out fantastic forward-firing sound with a decent kick of
bass, thanks to some tuning by Meridian Audio. The 18 hours of battery life is
impressive, though it will take nearly four hours to charge it fully—plan
ahead. If you're looking for a little more power, the [LG
PK7](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07CC4WMTP) is a good substitute.

[$97 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxkGXUxWXNYHqH2vN3MbBiXfgvKKrzRQKc7MtKV95r1Jvy6FVnBUcowgPsTiYpfC5YR?cid=5b103e5652d92f2e003123ef)

  * ![JBL boombox speaker](https://media.wired.com/photos/5b117dea44c29b1bf25f2376/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/JBL-Boombox-SOURCE-JBL-\(Official-Image\).jpg)

Photograph: JBL

## Boom Box

JBL Boombox Bluetooth Speaker

JBL's Boombox is comically huge for a Bluetooth speaker, but think of it as
the modern equivalent of a 1980s boom box, complete with a handle and some
intense bass. Break-dancers from the past would have killed for a speaker that
was completely waterproof and had 24 hours of battery life. The Boombox can
also connect to multiple smartphones at a time, so you don't have to DJ by
your lonesome. With a 20,000-mAh battery onboard, it can also charge your
gadgets for days.

(Note: The price fluctuates on this one. Don't pay more than $400.)

[$500 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxi9bopKi4dMCStFpntVZEqmwKNDKfFr1azEti62kQZPpfMscA8hQkPWt7TsnyK92Bk?cid=5b103e5652d92f2e003123ef)

  * ![Denon Envaya speaker](https://media.wired.com/photos/5cbfaa40365c6b2e53b10361/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/Denon-Envaya-Black-SOURCE-Denon.jpg)

Photograph: Denon

## Speaker Envy

Denon Envaya (3 Sizes)

Denon's three Envaya speakers don't look all that special—until you pair them.
I can't get enough of the largest model, the $200 8-inch DSB-250BT, and from
what I've read, the other two models ($99 and $149) sound excellent for their
size too. The Envaya's volume doesn't get extraordinarily loud, but it doesn't
distort. The audio clarity and range bring a playlist to life more than any
bargain speaker I've heard, thanks to an onboard amplifier.

Every model is IP67 waterproof, can pair with another Envaya speaker, and gets
between 10 and 12 hours on a charge. The rubber edges have also withstood a
couple of tumbles already. My only complaint is the lack of a Play/Pause
button, though the mic and ability to take calls almost makes up for it.

[$99 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxkgiqCRhyTpvxZryTVgbrYCy93k4EogXnrLGvRiUgR8iTTq7VAoyhT3GiEsZpDLB46?cid=5b103e5652d92f2e003123ef)

  * ![Bose speaker](https://media.wired.com/photos/5b117f204d07335caef49579/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/Bose-SoundLink-Revolve%2B-White-SOURCE-Bose.jpg)

Photograph: Bose

## I Just Really Like This One

Bose SoundLink Revolve+

It's not the cheapest, cutest, or most waterproof, but the Bose Revolve+ makes
me smile. It's probably the lantern-style fabric handle. It's completely
unnecessary but makes moving it from room to room a small joy. You can swing
it around and spread songs anywhere you go. People will like what they hear
too. Is a fun handle worth a $100 price bump? I'm beginning to think so.

[$239 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxi9bosBCmSRvfLhi952fwjmXaDFMH5aHohNDBJKrpC7AFVMcKsKtc8tnSiCxgNBKV5?cid=5b103e5652d92f2e003123ef)

  * ![Image may contain Electronics Camera and Electrical Device](https://media.wired.com/photos/5e38bacccb169d00086fdbf5/master/w_400%2Cc_limit/Gear-DemerBox-DB2-SOURCE-DemerBox.jpg)

Photograph: DemerBox

## Adventure Companion

DemerBox DB2

The DemerBox DB2 is a perfect companion to your boldest outdoor adventures, in
large part because it serves two purposes: It's a loud portable speaker with
40 hours of built-in battery life, and it's also a crush-proof Pelican case.

Load it up with any particularly fragile items and plug the bass port with an
included rubber stopper, and you've got yourself an everything-proof box to
keep your stuff safe. Add to the fact that the speaker sounds remarkably good,
with two large drivers that pump out a lot of sound, and this is our favorite
speaker to take to the beach, campground, or mountain. We also like that
they're made in the US and fully serviceable by DemerBox, so the somewhat
steep entry price is actually justifiable long-term.

[$339 at
Amazon](https://cna.st/p/2hc5hQAHwfj8VPYK7Qk9GwUbxRSgyWyQM4qy5vcfAxpYnBLRAjYRCDGFtYjrV1VBXQWC9DcH7HFDxzrgidpG24BDW16XzkSi28P5un2ryMe?cid=5b103e5652d92f2e003123ef)

## Honorable Mentions

Pretty Good Speakers

Here are a few other good products that didn't quite make the cut.

The [Oontz Angle 3 speaker ($40)](https://www.amazon.com/OontZ-Angle-Ultra-Hi-
Quality-Splashproof/dp/B073BVWRSP/) has thousands of positive reviews on
Amazon and is easily the best dirt-cheap Bluetooth speaker we've ever tested.
If you just want something to sing along with in the shower—and you're not a
stickler for great audio quality—snag one of these.

The [Bose SoundLink Revolve ($159)](https://www.amazon.com/Bose-SoundLink-
Revolve-Portable-Bluetooth/dp/B06XCQKTKR/) is nowhere near as endearing as the
Boom 3 and isn't waterproof (only splash resistant), but you'll be hard-
pressed to find a beer-can-sized speaker that sounds as clear and deep-
throated. The controls are easy to use, with verbal audio cues and simple
Bluetooth pairing, and the 12-hour battery life is long enough to make it
through any party.

The [Scosche BoomBottle ($100)](https://www.amazon.com/BoomBottle-Waterproof-
Integrated-MagicMount-Smartphones/dp/B07G2LL6GR/) is built for a lazy day on
the river, with a built-in bottle opener and magnets that let it attach to
phones and other objects like a canoe. It's waterproof too. It does make a
sound when it turns on and off that didn't bother me but did annoy some
friends who used it daily at an office.

[Sony's SRS-XB speaker series
($66+)](https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B079V81NS8/) is also excellent, with
great bass and colorful LED lights. Its downside is that the volume dips when
it's low on battery and won't rise back up until it's fully charged.
